sen.j: 水主皇女（みぬしのひめみこ、生年不詳 - 天平9年8月20日 (旧暦)（737年9月22日））は、天智天皇の皇女。
sen.e: Minushi no himemiko (year of birth unknown-September 22, 737) was the princess of Emperor Tenchi.
Minushi no Himemiko (year of birth unknown - September 22, 737) was the daughter of Emperor Tenchi.
Minushi no Himemiko (year of birth unknown - September 22, 737) was the daughter of Emperor Tenchi.

sen.j: 母は栗隈首徳万の娘、黒媛娘。
sen.e: Her mother was Kurome no Iratsume, the daughter of KUROKUMA no Shutokuma.
Her mother was Kurome no Iratsume, the daughter of KUROKUMA no Shutokuma.
Her mother was Kurome no Iratsume, the daughter of KUROKUMA no Shutokuma.

sen.j: 名前はもいとりともいう。
sen.e: She was also called 'Moitori.'
She was also called 'Moitori.'
She was also called 'Moitori.'

sen.j: 天智天皇の皇子女では、最後まで生き残った。
sen.e: Among the princes and princesses of Emperor Tenchi, she lived the longest life.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: She outlived all of Emperor Tenchi's other children.
She outlived all of Emperor Tenchi's other children.

sen.j: しかし、他の皇女とは違い、彼女に関する詳細な記録はほとんど無く、どのような人生を送ったかは不明な点が多い。
sen.e: Unlike other princesses, however, few are known as to what kind of life she had had because detailed descriptions of her life are scarcely found.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, unlike other princesses, there are almost no detailed records relating to her and there are therefore many uncertainties regarding what type of life she led.
However, unlike other princesses, there are almost no detailed records relating to her and there are therefore many uncertainties regarding what type of life she led.

sen.j: 晩年元正天皇に仕えていたらしい。
sen.e: It seems that Minushi no himemiko served Emperor Gensho at her last years.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It seems that Minushi no Himemiko served Emperor Gensho at her last years.
It seems that Minushi no Himemiko served Emperor Gensho at her last years.

sen.j: 病気で宮中に出仕できずにいた水主皇女を慰める為、雪を詠った歌を作る様、元正天皇が命じた。
sen.e: When she was unable to come to the Imperial Palace because of illness, Emperor Gensho ordered to create verses themed on snow to console her.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: When she was unable to come to the Imperial Palace because of illness, Emperor Gensho ordered the composition of a poem themed on snow to console her.
sen.cmt: to create verses > the composition of a poem
sen.e: When she was unable to come to the Imperial Palace because of illness, Emperor Gensho ordered the composition of a poem themed on snow to console her.

sen.j: 石川内命婦が奉上した歌が「万葉集」巻20－4439に残されている。
sen.e: The verses written by ISHIKAWA no Uchimyobu at that time is compiled in "Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves), the 4439th line of the volume 20.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The poem written by ISHIKAWA no Uchimyobu is compiled in "Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves), the 4439th line of the volume 20.
The poem written by ISHIKAWA no Uchimyobu is compiled in "Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves), the 4439th line of the volume 20.

sen.j: 熱心な仏教信者だったようで、天平6年（734年）大和国広瀬郡の水陸田を購入し弘福寺に施入している。
sen.e: It seems that Minushi no himemiko was a dedicated Buddhist; she purchased rice and crop fields in Hirose County of Yamato Province and presented them to Gufuku-ji Temple in 734.
It seems that Minushi no Himemiko was a dedicated Buddhist; she purchased rice and crop fields in Hirose County of Yamato Province and presented them to Gufuku-ji Temple in 734.
It seems that Minushi no Himemiko was a dedicated Buddhist; she purchased rice and crop fields in Hirose County of Yamato Province and presented them to Gufuku-ji Temple in 734.

sen.j: 彼女が作成した「水主宮経」は写経の為に各所に貸し出され、目録も作られたほどである。
sen.e: "The Minushi-no-miya Sutra," which was created by Minushi no himemiko, became popular to the extent that it was leased to many places, and even the catalogue was made.
"The Minushi-no-miya Sutra," which was created by Minushi no Himemiko, became popular to the extent that it was leased to many places, and even an index was made.
"The Minushi-no-miya Sutra," which was created by Minushi no Himemiko, became popular to the extent that it was loaned to many places for transcription, and even an index was made.
sen.cmt: 「写経の為に」 訳漏れ対応しました。leased→loaned

sen.j: 天平9年（737年）2月14日三品に昇進し、その年の8月20日に薨去した。
sen.e: On February 14, 737, she was promoted to Third Rank but passed away on August 20 in the same year.
sen.cmt: 737年は変換の計算範囲外なので、旧暦のままにしてあります。
sen.e: On February 14, 737, she was promoted to Third Rank but passed away on August 20 of the same year.
On March 23, 737, she was promoted to Third Rank but passed away on September 22 of the same year.
Verses related to Minushi no himemiko
Poems Related to Minushi no Himemiko
Poems Related to Minushi no Himemiko

sen.j: 万葉集に以下の歌が残されている。
sen.e: The following poet is recorded in Manyoshu.
The following poems are recorded in Manyoshu.
The following poems are recorded in Manyoshu.

sen.j: 冬の日、靱負（ゆけひ）の御井（みゐ）に幸いでましし時、内命婦（うちのひめとね）石川朝臣 諱曰邑婆 詔を応（うけたま）はりて雪を賦（よ）める歌一首
sen.e: When Emperor Gensho came to the well near the Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards, ISHIKAWA no Asomi Kietsuoba, a senior court lady (uchinohimeotone), wrote the following verses themed on snow upon Emperor's order.

When Emperor Gensho came to the well near the Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards, he ordered ISHIKAWA no Asomi Kietsuoba, a senior court lady (uchinohimeotone), to write the following snow-themed.

When Emperor Gensho came to the well near the Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards, he ordered ISHIKAWA no Asomi Kietsuoba, a senior court lady (uchinohimetone), to write the following snow-themed.

sen.j: 松が枝の地につくまで降る雪を 見ずてや妹が籠もりをるらむ 巻20-4439
sen.e: It snows heavily outside/ Branches of pine bow to the ground/ Without enjoying the scenery/ Lady is in bed behind the screen: Volume 20-4439
It snows heavily outside/ Branches of pine bow to the ground/ Without enjoying the scenery/ Lady is in bed behind the screen: Volume 20-4439
It snows heavily outside/ Branches of pine bow to the ground/ Without enjoying the scenery/ Lady is in bed behind the screen: Volume 20-4439

sen.j: その時、水主内親王、寝膳安からず。
sen.e: At that time, Imperial Princess Minushi was ill in bed.
At that time, Imperial Princess Minushi was ill in bed.
At that time, Imperial Princess Minushi was ill in bed.
And she could not come to the Imperial Palace for several days.
She was unable to come to the Imperial Palace for several days.
She was unable to come to the Imperial Palace for several days.

sen.j: 因此の日太上天皇、侍嬬等に勅りたまはく、水主内親王の為に、雪を賦みて奉献れとのりたまへり。
sen.e: Therefore, His Imperial Majesty ordered court ladies to create verses themed on snow and dedicated them to Princess Minushi.
Therefore, His Imperial Majesty ordered court ladies to compose poems themed on snow and dedicated them to Princess Minushi.
Therefore, His Imperial Majesty ordered court ladies to compose poems themed on snow and dedicated them to Princess Minushi.

sen.j: 是に諸の命婦等、作歌し堪ねたれば、此の石川命婦、独り此の歌を作みて奏せりき。
sen.e: Although many court ladies created their own verses, only this Ishikawa no Myobu succeeded in creating the verses of this quality and in presenting the verses.
sen.cmt: 日本文の意味が不明です。
sen.e: Although many court ladies created their own verses, only Ishikawa no Myobu succeeded in creating the verses of this quality and in presenting the verses to the emperor.
Although many court ladies created their own verses, only Ishikawa no Myobu succeeded in creating the verses of this quality and in presenting the verses to the emperor.
sen.cmt: 日本文の意味が不明です。
